required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ORTD-1 in Patients Hospitalized With COVID-19 Related Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: A Blinded, Controlled, Escalating Dose Study of ORTD-1 for Treatment of Hospitalized Patients With SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Related Pneumonia.

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the safety and effect of ORTD-1 on COVID-19 related pneumonia.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, blinded, vehicle-controlled dose-escalation study. Initial enrollment and treatment will be conducted as an inpatient study. Patients will be randomized 2:1, ORTD-1 treatment versus vehicle control. Patients will be allocated into 1 of 3 sequential escalating dose cohorts. Blinded study drug will be infused intravenously once daily for 5 consecutive days.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients will be allocated into 1 of 3 sequential escalating dose cohorts and randomized to ORTD-1 treatment versus vehicle control within each cohort.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events
Number of participants with Grade 3 or higher laboratory abnormalities
Number of participants who develop antibodies to ORTD-1

secondary_outcome.description: The requirement of intubation and invasive ventilation will be assessed for patients at each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of days requiring supplemental oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of days for which the patient requires supplemental oxygen will be recorded.
Overall survival is defined as the time from enrollment until death from any cause.

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1-Day 7, Day 14, Day 21, Day 28, Day 35, Day 65
other_outcome.description: SpO2 over time will be measured by pulse oximetry.
Level of the inflammatory biomarker IL-6 in blood will be measured.
Level of the inflammatory biomarker TNF- alpha in blood will be measured.
Level of the inflammatory biomarker C-reactive protein in blood will be measured.
Level of serum ferritin in blood will be measured.
Level of D-dimer in blood will be measured.
Serum concentration of ORTD-1 will be measured following IV infusion and during follow-up

intervention.description: ORTD-1 will be administered intravenously once daily for 5 consecutive days.
ORTD-1 will be administered intravenously once daily for 5 consecutive days.
ORTD-1 will be administered intravenously once daily for 5 consecutive days.
Vehicle Control will be administered intravenously once daily for 5 consecutive days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Positive RT-PCR assay for SARS CoV-2 in a respiratory tract sample
- Hospitalized for COVID-19
- Radiographic diagnosis of pneumonia
- Respiratory insufficiency
- Receiving pharmacologic thromboprophylaxis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Premorbid abnormal pulmonary function or disease
- Concurrent or prior intubation or ventilated support for COVID-19
- Receiving systemic corticosteroids or other immunomodulators or immunosuppressant drugs
- Previous hospitalization for COVID-19

overall_official.affiliation: Professor & Chair, Department of Medicine University of California, Irvine
